verses.roman:
pika-svara-kaṇṭha, tāte rāgera vibhāga
eka-śloka paḍite phirāya tina-cāri rāga

synonyms: pika-svara-kaṇṭha—a very sweet voice like a cuckoo's; tāte—above that; rāgera—of tunes; vibhāga—division; eka-śloka—one verse; paḍite—reciting; phirāya—changes; tina-cāri rāga—three or four different tunes.
translation: His voice was as sweet as a cuckoo's, and he would recite each verse of Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam in three or four tunes. Thus his recitations were very sweet to hear.
